citations.narrative:
Most dogs were wearing their ID tag, however two dogs had lost their tag (one tag was found during inspection) and some
dogs' ID tags were lacking the required letters 'USDA' and License Number. Properly identifying dogs is required and can
be important for health tracking. Ensure that each tag is affixed to each dog's neck by means of a collar made of material
generally considered acceptable to pet owners as a means of identifying their pet dog and that each tag has the required
information including the letters 'USDA' and the license number.

citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
The record of adult dog physical exams that the facility had for previous inspections could not be located this inspection. A
note on the written program of veterinary care (PVC) suggests that adult physical exams were last done November 28,
2022. Ensure to locate the record of physical exams for the adult dogs or work with the attending veterinarian to get an
updated physical exam on each dog (which is required for each dog within every 12 months) and maintain a record of the
physical exam findings.
Correct by November 28, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.50  Repeat
   
Time and method of identification. 
Most dogs were wearing their ID tag, however two dogs had lost their tag (one tag was found during inspection) and some 
dogs' ID tags were lacking the required letters 'USDA' and License Number. Properly identifying dogs is required and can 
be important for health tracking. Ensure that each tag is affixed to each dog's neck by means of a collar made of material 
generally considered acceptable to pet owners as a means of identifying their pet dog and that each tag has the required 
information including the letters 'USDA' and the license number. 
2.126(a)(2) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
The record of adult dog physical exams that the facility had for previous inspections could not be located this inspection. A 
note on the written program of veterinary care (PVC) suggests that adult physical exams were last done November 28, 
2022. Ensure to locate the record of physical exams for the adult dogs or work with the attending veterinarian to get an 
updated physical exam on each dog (which is required for each dog within every 12 months) and maintain a record of the 
physical exam findings.  
 
Correct by November 28, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
 n
